00118 #define MAX_IDPUP       60  /* was 24 */

00120 /* GS reads the memory pointed at in a specific ordering. 
00121  * only use this definition, makes little and big endian systems
00122  * work fine, in conjunction with MAKE_ID */
00123 
00124 /* from blendef: */
00125 #define GS(a)   (*((short *)(a)))

00129 
00130 /* this has to be called from each make_local_* func, we could call
00131  * from id_make_local() but then the make local functions would not be self
00132  * contained.
00133  * also note that the id _must_ have a library - campbell */
00134 void BKE_id_lib_local_paths(Main *bmain, Library *lib, ID *id)
00135 {
00136     char *bpath_user_data[2]= {bmain->name, lib->filepath};
00137 
00138     bpath_traverse_id(bmain, id,
00139                       bpath_relocate_visitor,
00140                       BPATH_TRAVERSE_SKIP_MULTIFILE,
00141                       bpath_user_data);
00142 }
00143 
00144 void id_lib_extern(ID *id)
00145 {
00146     if (id) {
00147         if (id->flag & LIB_INDIRECT) {
00148             id->flag -= LIB_INDIRECT;
00149             id->flag |= LIB_EXTERN;
00150         }
00151     }
00152 }
00153 
00154 void id_us_plus(ID *id)
00155 {
00156     if (id) {
00157         id->us++;
00158         if (id->flag & LIB_INDIRECT) {
00159             id->flag -= LIB_INDIRECT;
00160             id->flag |= LIB_EXTERN;
00161         }
00162     }
00163 }
00164 
00165 void id_us_min(ID *id)
00166 {
00167     if (id) {
00168         if (id->us < 2 && (id->flag & LIB_FAKEUSER)) {
00169             id->us= 1;
00170         }
00171         else if (id->us <= 0) {
00172             printf("ID user decrement error: %s\n", id->name);
00173         }
00174         else {
00175             id->us--;
00176         }
00177     }
00178 }
00179 
00180 int id_make_local(ID *id, int test)
00181 {
00182     if (id->flag & LIB_INDIRECT)
00183         return 0;
00184 
00185     switch(GS(id->name)) {
00186         case ID_SCE:
00187             return 0; /* not implemented */
00188         case ID_LI:
00189             return 0; /* can't be linked */
00190         case ID_OB:
00191             if (!test) make_local_object((Object*)id);
00192             return 1;
00193         case ID_ME:
00194             if (!test) {
00195                 make_local_mesh((Mesh*)id);
00196                 make_local_key(((Mesh*)id)->key);
00197             }
00198             return 1;
00199         case ID_CU:
00200             if (!test) {
00201                 make_local_curve((Curve*)id);
00202                 make_local_key(((Curve*)id)->key);
00203             }
00204             return 1;
00205         case ID_MB:
00206             if (!test) make_local_mball((MetaBall*)id);
00207             return 1;
00208         case ID_MA:
00209             if (!test) make_local_material((Material*)id);
00210             return 1;
00211         case ID_TE:
00212             if (!test) make_local_texture((Tex*)id);
00213             return 1;
00214         case ID_IM:
00215             if (!test) make_local_image((Image*)id);
00216             return 1;
00217         case ID_LT:
00218             if (!test) {
00219                 make_local_lattice((Lattice*)id);
00220                 make_local_key(((Lattice*)id)->key);
00221             }
00222             return 1;
00223         case ID_LA:
00224             if (!test) make_local_lamp((Lamp*)id);
00225             return 1;
00226         case ID_CA:
00227             if (!test) make_local_camera((Camera*)id);
00228             return 1;
00229         case ID_SPK:
00230             if (!test) make_local_speaker((Speaker*)id);
00231             return 1;
00232         case ID_IP:
00233             return 0; /* deprecated */
00234         case ID_KE:
00235             if (!test) make_local_key((Key*)id);
00236             return 1;
00237         case ID_WO:
00238             if (!test) make_local_world((World*)id);
00239             return 1;
00240         case ID_SCR:
00241             return 0; /* can't be linked */
00242         case ID_VF:
00243             return 0; /* not implemented */
00244         case ID_TXT:
00245             return 0; /* not implemented */
00246         case ID_SCRIPT:
00247             return 0; /* deprecated */
00248         case ID_SO:
00249             return 0; /* not implemented */
00250         case ID_GR:
00251             return 0; /* not implemented */
00252         case ID_AR:
00253             if (!test) make_local_armature((bArmature*)id);
00254             return 1;
00255         case ID_AC:
00256             if (!test) make_local_action((bAction*)id);
00257             return 1;
00258         case ID_NT:
00259             return 0; /* not implemented */
00260         case ID_BR:
00261             if (!test) make_local_brush((Brush*)id);
00262             return 1;
00263         case ID_PA:
00264             if (!test) make_local_particlesettings((ParticleSettings*)id);
00265             return 1;
00266         case ID_WM:
00267             return 0; /* can't be linked */
00268         case ID_GD:
00269             return 0; /* not implemented */
00270     }
00271 
00272     return 0;
00273 }
00274 
00275 int id_copy(ID *id, ID **newid, int test)
00276 {
00277     if (!test) *newid= NULL;
00278 
00279     /* conventions:
00280      * - make shallow copy, only this ID block
00281      * - id.us of the new ID is set to 1 */
00282     switch(GS(id->name)) {
00283         case ID_SCE:
00284             return 0; /* can't be copied from here */
00285         case ID_LI:
00286             return 0; /* can't be copied from here */
00287         case ID_OB:
00288             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_object((Object*)id);
00289             return 1;
00290         case ID_ME:
00291             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_mesh((Mesh*)id);
00292             return 1;
00293         case ID_CU:
00294             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_curve((Curve*)id);
00295             return 1;
00296         case ID_MB:
00297             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_mball((MetaBall*)id);
00298             return 1;
00299         case ID_MA:
00300             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_material((Material*)id);
00301             return 1;
00302         case ID_TE:
00303             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_texture((Tex*)id);
00304             return 1;
00305         case ID_IM:
00306             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_image((Image*)id);
00307             return 1;
00308         case ID_LT:
00309             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_lattice((Lattice*)id);
00310             return 1;
00311         case ID_LA:
00312             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_lamp((Lamp*)id);
00313             return 1;
00314         case ID_SPK:
00315             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_speaker((Speaker*)id);
00316             return 1;
00317         case ID_CA:
00318             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_camera((Camera*)id);
00319             return 1;
00320         case ID_IP:
00321             return 0; /* deprecated */
00322         case ID_KE:
00323             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_key((Key*)id);
00324             return 1;
00325         case ID_WO:
00326             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_world((World*)id);
00327             return 1;
00328         case ID_SCR:
00329             return 0; /* can't be copied from here */
00330         case ID_VF:
00331             return 0; /* not implemented */
00332         case ID_TXT:
00333             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_text((Text*)id);
00334             return 1;
00335         case ID_SCRIPT:
00336             return 0; /* deprecated */
00337         case ID_SO:
00338             return 0; /* not implemented */
00339         case ID_GR:
00340             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_group((Group*)id);
00341             return 1;
00342         case ID_AR:
00343             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_armature((bArmature*)id);
00344             return 1;
00345         case ID_AC:
00346             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_action((bAction*)id);
00347             return 1;
00348         case ID_NT:
00349             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)ntreeCopyTree((bNodeTree*)id);
00350             return 1;
00351         case ID_BR:
00352             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)copy_brush((Brush*)id);
00353             return 1;
00354         case ID_PA:
00355             if (!test) *newid= (ID*)psys_copy_settings((ParticleSettings*)id);
00356             return 1;
00357         case ID_WM:
00358             return 0; /* can't be copied from here */
00359         case ID_GD:
00360             return 0; /* not implemented */
00361     }
00362     
00363     return 0;
00364 }
00365 
00366 int id_unlink(ID *id, int test)
00367 {
00368     Main *mainlib= G.main;
00369     ListBase *lb;
00370 
00371     switch(GS(id->name)) {
00372         case ID_TXT:
00373             if (test) return 1;
00374             unlink_text(mainlib, (Text*)id);
00375             break;
00376         case ID_GR:
00377             if (test) return 1;
00378             unlink_group((Group*)id);
00379             break;
00380         case ID_OB:
00381             if (test) return 1;
00382             unlink_object((Object*)id);
00383             break;
00384     }
00385 
00386     if (id->us == 0) {
00387         if (test) return 1;
00388 
00389         lb= which_libbase(mainlib, GS(id->name));
00390         free_libblock(lb, id);
00391 
00392         return 1;
00393     }
00394 
00395     return 0;
00396 }
00397 
00398 int id_single_user(bContext *C, ID *id, PointerRNA *ptr, PropertyRNA *prop)
00399 {
00400     ID *newid = NULL;
00401     PointerRNA idptr;
00402     
00403     if (id) {
00404         /* if property isn't editable, we're going to have an extra block hanging around until we save */
00405         if (RNA_property_editable(ptr, prop)) {
00406             if (id_copy(id, &newid, 0) && newid) {
00407                 /* copy animation actions too */
00408                 BKE_copy_animdata_id_action(id);
00409                 /* us is 1 by convention, but RNA_property_pointer_set
00410                  * will also increment it, so set it to zero */
00411                 newid->us = 0;
00412                 
00413                 /* assign copy */
00414                 RNA_id_pointer_create(newid, &idptr);
00415                 RNA_property_pointer_set(ptr, prop, idptr);
00416                 RNA_property_update(C, ptr, prop);
00417                 
00418                 return 1;
00419             }
00420         }
00421     }
00422     
00423     return 0;
00424 }
00425 
00426 ListBase *which_libbase(Main *mainlib, short type)
00427 {
00428     switch( type ) {
00429         case ID_SCE:
00430             return &(mainlib->scene);
00431         case ID_LI:
00432             return &(mainlib->library);
00433         case ID_OB:
00434             return &(mainlib->object);
00435         case ID_ME:
00436             return &(mainlib->mesh);
00437         case ID_CU:
00438             return &(mainlib->curve);
00439         case ID_MB:
00440             return &(mainlib->mball);
00441         case ID_MA:
00442             return &(mainlib->mat);
00443         case ID_TE:
00444             return &(mainlib->tex);
00445         case ID_IM:
00446             return &(mainlib->image);
00447         case ID_LT:
00448             return &(mainlib->latt);
00449         case ID_LA:
00450             return &(mainlib->lamp);
00451         case ID_CA:
00452             return &(mainlib->camera);
00453         case ID_IP:
00454             return &(mainlib->ipo);
00455         case ID_KE:
00456             return &(mainlib->key);
00457         case ID_WO:
00458             return &(mainlib->world);
00459         case ID_SCR:
00460             return &(mainlib->screen);
00461         case ID_VF:
00462             return &(mainlib->vfont);
00463         case ID_TXT:
00464             return &(mainlib->text);
00465         case ID_SCRIPT:
00466             return &(mainlib->script);
00467         case ID_SPK:
00468             return &(mainlib->speaker);
00469         case ID_SO:
00470             return &(mainlib->sound);
00471         case ID_GR:
00472             return &(mainlib->group);
00473         case ID_AR:
00474             return &(mainlib->armature);
00475         case ID_AC:
00476             return &(mainlib->action);
00477         case ID_NT:
00478             return &(mainlib->nodetree);
00479         case ID_BR:
00480             return &(mainlib->brush);
00481         case ID_PA:
00482             return &(mainlib->particle);
00483         case ID_WM:
00484             return &(mainlib->wm);
00485         case ID_GD:
00486             return &(mainlib->gpencil);
00487         case ID_MC:
00488             return &(mainlib->movieclip);
00489     }
00490     return NULL;
00491 }
00492 
00493 /* Flag all ids in listbase */
00494 void flag_listbase_ids(ListBase *lb, short flag, short value)
00495 {
00496     ID *id;
00497     if (value) {
00498         for (id= lb->first; id; id= id->next) id->flag |= flag;
00499     }
00500     else {
00501         flag = ~flag;
00502         for (id= lb->first; id; id= id->next) id->flag &= flag;
00503     }
00504 }
00505 
00506 /* Flag all ids in listbase */
00507 void flag_all_listbases_ids(short flag, short value)
00508 {
00509     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY];
00510     int a;
00511     a= set_listbasepointers(G.main, lbarray);
00512     while (a--) flag_listbase_ids(lbarray[a], flag, value);
00513 }
00514 
00515 void recalc_all_library_objects(Main *main)
00516 {
00517     Object *ob;
00518 
00519     /* flag for full recalc */
00520     for (ob=main->object.first; ob; ob=ob->id.next)
00521         if (ob->id.lib)
00522             ob->recalc |= OB_RECALC_OB|OB_RECALC_DATA|OB_RECALC_TIME;
00523 }
00524 
00525 /* note: MAX_LIBARRAY define should match this code */
00526 int set_listbasepointers(Main *main, ListBase **lb)
00527 {
00528     int a = 0;
00529 
00530     /* BACKWARDS! also watch order of free-ing! (mesh<->mat), first items freed last.
00531      * This is important because freeing data decreases usercounts of other datablocks,
00532      * if this data is its self freed it can crash. */
00533     lb[a++]= &(main->ipo);
00534     lb[a++]= &(main->action); // xxx moved here to avoid problems when freeing with animato (aligorith)
00535     lb[a++]= &(main->key);
00536     lb[a++]= &(main->gpencil); /* referenced by nodes, objects, view, scene etc, before to free after. */
00537     lb[a++]= &(main->nodetree);
00538     lb[a++]= &(main->image);
00539     lb[a++]= &(main->tex);
00540     lb[a++]= &(main->mat);
00541     lb[a++]= &(main->vfont);
00542     
00543     /* Important!: When adding a new object type,
00544      * the specific data should be inserted here 
00545      */
00546 
00547     lb[a++]= &(main->armature);
00548 
00549     lb[a++]= &(main->mesh);
00550     lb[a++]= &(main->curve);
00551     lb[a++]= &(main->mball);
00552 
00553     lb[a++]= &(main->latt);
00554     lb[a++]= &(main->lamp);
00555     lb[a++]= &(main->camera);
00556 
00557     lb[a++]= &(main->text);
00558     lb[a++]= &(main->sound);
00559     lb[a++]= &(main->group);
00560     lb[a++]= &(main->brush);
00561     lb[a++]= &(main->script);
00562     lb[a++]= &(main->particle);
00563     lb[a++]= &(main->speaker);
00564 
00565     lb[a++]= &(main->world);
00566     lb[a++]= &(main->screen);
00567     lb[a++]= &(main->object);
00568     lb[a++]= &(main->scene);
00569     lb[a++]= &(main->library);
00570     lb[a++]= &(main->wm);
00571     lb[a++]= &(main->movieclip);
00572     
00573     lb[a]= NULL;
00574 
00575     return a;
00576 }
00577 
00578 /* *********** ALLOC AND FREE *****************
00579  *
00580  * free_libblock(ListBase *lb, ID *id )
00581  * provide a list-basis and datablock, but only ID is read
00582  *
00583  * void *alloc_libblock(ListBase *lb, type, name)
00584  * inserts in list and returns a new ID
00585  *
00586  * **************************** */
00587 
00588 static ID *alloc_libblock_notest(short type)
00589 {
00590     ID *id= NULL;
00591     
00592     switch( type ) {
00593         case ID_SCE:
00594             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Scene), "scene");
00595             break;
00596         case ID_LI:
00597             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Library), "library");
00598             break;
00599         case ID_OB:
00600             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Object), "object");
00601             break;
00602         case ID_ME:
00603             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Mesh), "mesh");
00604             break;
00605         case ID_CU:
00606             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Curve), "curve");
00607             break;
00608         case ID_MB:
00609             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(MetaBall), "mball");
00610             break;
00611         case ID_MA:
00612             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Material), "mat");
00613             break;
00614         case ID_TE:
00615             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Tex), "tex");
00616             break;
00617         case ID_IM:
00618             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Image), "image");
00619             break;
00620         case ID_LT:
00621             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Lattice), "latt");
00622             break;
00623         case ID_LA:
00624             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Lamp), "lamp");
00625             break;
00626         case ID_CA:
00627             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Camera), "camera");
00628             break;
00629         case ID_IP:
00630             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Ipo), "ipo");
00631             break;
00632         case ID_KE:
00633             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Key), "key");
00634             break;
00635         case ID_WO:
00636             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(World), "world");
00637             break;
00638         case ID_SCR:
00639             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bScreen), "screen");
00640             break;
00641         case ID_VF:
00642             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(VFont), "vfont");
00643             break;
00644         case ID_TXT:
00645             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Text), "text");
00646             break;
00647         case ID_SCRIPT:
00648             //XXX id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Script), "script");
00649             break;
00650         case ID_SPK:
00651             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Speaker), "speaker");
00652             break;
00653         case ID_SO:
00654             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bSound), "sound");
00655             break;
00656         case ID_GR:
00657             id= MEM_callocN(sizeof(Group), "group");
00658             break;
00659         case ID_AR:
00660             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bArmature), "armature");
00661             break;
00662         case ID_AC:
00663             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bAction), "action");
00664             break;
00665         case ID_NT:
00666             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bNodeTree), "nodetree");
00667             break;
00668         case ID_BR:
00669             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(Brush), "brush");
00670             break;
00671         case ID_PA:
00672             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(ParticleSettings), "ParticleSettings");
00673             break;
00674         case ID_WM:
00675             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(wmWindowManager), "Window manager");
00676             break;
00677         case ID_GD:
00678             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bGPdata), "Grease Pencil");
00679             break;
00680         case ID_MC:
00681             id = MEM_callocN(sizeof(MovieClip), "Movie Clip");
00682             break;
00683     }
00684     return id;
00685 }
00686 
00687 /* used everywhere in blenkernel and text.c */
00688 void *alloc_libblock(ListBase *lb, short type, const char *name)
00689 {
00690     ID *id= NULL;
00691     
00692     id= alloc_libblock_notest(type);
00693     if (id) {
00694         BLI_addtail(lb, id);
00695         id->us= 1;
00696         id->icon_id = 0;
00697         *( (short *)id->name )= type;
00698         new_id(lb, id, name);
00699         /* alphabetic insterion: is in new_id */
00700     }
00701     return id;
00702 }
00703 
00704 /* by spec, animdata is first item after ID */
00705 /* and, trust that BKE_animdata_from_id() will only find AnimData for valid ID-types */
00706 static void id_copy_animdata(ID *id, const short do_action)
00707 {
00708     AnimData *adt= BKE_animdata_from_id(id);
00709     
00710     if (adt) {
00711         IdAdtTemplate *iat = (IdAdtTemplate *)id;
00712         iat->adt= BKE_copy_animdata(iat->adt, do_action); /* could be set to FALSE, need to investigate */
00713     }
00714 }
00715 
00716 /* material nodes use this since they are not treated as libdata */
00717 void copy_libblock_data(ID *id, const ID *id_from, const short do_action)
00718 {
00719     if (id_from->properties)
00720         id->properties = IDP_CopyProperty(id_from->properties);
00721 
00722     /* the duplicate should get a copy of the animdata */
00723     id_copy_animdata(id, do_action);
00724 }
00725 
00726 /* used everywhere in blenkernel */
00727 void *copy_libblock(ID *id)
00728 {
00729     ID *idn;
00730     ListBase *lb;
00731     size_t idn_len;
00732 
00733     lb= which_libbase(G.main, GS(id->name));
00734     idn= alloc_libblock(lb, GS(id->name), id->name+2);
00735 
00736     assert(idn != NULL);
00737 
00738     idn_len= MEM_allocN_len(idn);
00739     if ((int)idn_len - (int)sizeof(ID) > 0) { /* signed to allow neg result */
00740         const char *cp= (const char *)id;
00741         char *cpn= (char *)idn;
00742 
00743         memcpy(cpn+sizeof(ID), cp+sizeof(ID), idn_len - sizeof(ID));
00744     }
00745     
00746     id->newid= idn;
00747     idn->flag |= LIB_NEW;
00748 
00749     copy_libblock_data(idn, id, FALSE);
00750     
00751     return idn;
00752 }

00755 {
00756     /* no freeing needed for libraries yet */
00757 }

00759 static void (*free_windowmanager_cb)(bContext *, wmWindowManager *)= NULL;
00760 
00761 void set_free_windowmanager_cb(void (*func)(bContext *C, wmWindowManager *) )
00762 {
00763     free_windowmanager_cb= func;
00764 }
00765 
00766 static void animdata_dtar_clear_cb(ID *UNUSED(id), AnimData *adt, void *userdata)
00767 {
00768     ChannelDriver *driver;
00769     FCurve *fcu;
00770 
00771     /* find the driver this belongs to and update it */
00772     for (fcu=adt->drivers.first; fcu; fcu=fcu->next) {
00773         driver= fcu->driver;
00774         
00775         if (driver) {
00776             DriverVar *dvar;
00777             for (dvar= driver->variables.first; dvar; dvar= dvar->next) {
00778                 DRIVER_TARGETS_USED_LOOPER(dvar) 
00779                 {
00780                     if (dtar->id == userdata)
00781                         dtar->id= NULL;
00782                 }
00783                 DRIVER_TARGETS_LOOPER_END
00784             }
00785         }
00786     }
00787 }
00788 
00789 
00790 /* used in headerbuttons.c image.c mesh.c screen.c sound.c and library.c */
00791 void free_libblock(ListBase *lb, void *idv)
00792 {
00793     ID *id= idv;
00794 
00795 #ifdef WITH_PYTHON
00796     BPY_id_release(id);
00797 #endif
00798 
00799     switch( GS(id->name) ) {    /* GetShort from util.h */
00800         case ID_SCE:
00801             free_scene((Scene *)id);
00802             break;
00803         case ID_LI:
00804             free_library((Library *)id);
00805             break;
00806         case ID_OB:
00807             free_object((Object *)id);
00808             break;
00809         case ID_ME:
00810             free_mesh((Mesh *)id, 1);
00811             break;
00812         case ID_CU:
00813             free_curve((Curve *)id);
00814             break;
00815         case ID_MB:
00816             free_mball((MetaBall *)id);
00817             break;
00818         case ID_MA:
00819             free_material((Material *)id);
00820             break;
00821         case ID_TE:
00822             free_texture((Tex *)id);
00823             break;
00824         case ID_IM:
00825             free_image((Image *)id);
00826             break;
00827         case ID_LT:
00828             free_lattice((Lattice *)id);
00829             break;
00830         case ID_LA:
00831             free_lamp((Lamp *)id);
00832             break;
00833         case ID_CA:
00834             free_camera((Camera*) id);
00835             break;
00836         case ID_IP:
00837             free_ipo((Ipo *)id);
00838             break;
00839         case ID_KE:
00840             free_key((Key *)id);
00841             break;
00842         case ID_WO:
00843             free_world((World *)id);
00844             break;
00845         case ID_SCR:
00846             free_screen((bScreen *)id);
00847             break;
00848         case ID_VF:
00849             free_vfont((VFont *)id);
00850             break;
00851         case ID_TXT:
00852             free_text((Text *)id);
00853             break;
00854         case ID_SCRIPT:
00855             //XXX free_script((Script *)id);
00856             break;
00857         case ID_SPK:
00858             free_speaker((Speaker *)id);
00859             break;
00860         case ID_SO:
00861             sound_free((bSound*)id);
00862             break;
00863         case ID_GR:
00864             free_group_objects((Group *)id);
00865             break;
00866         case ID_AR:
00867             free_armature((bArmature *)id);
00868             break;
00869         case ID_AC:
00870             free_action((bAction *)id);
00871             break;
00872         case ID_NT:
00873             ntreeFreeTree((bNodeTree *)id);
00874             break;
00875         case ID_BR:
00876             free_brush((Brush *)id);
00877             break;
00878         case ID_PA:
00879             psys_free_settings((ParticleSettings *)id);
00880             break;
00881         case ID_WM:
00882             if (free_windowmanager_cb)
00883                 free_windowmanager_cb(NULL, (wmWindowManager *)id);
00884             break;
00885         case ID_GD:
00886             free_gpencil_data((bGPdata *)id);
00887             break;
00888         case ID_MC:
00889             free_movieclip((MovieClip *)id);
00890             break;
00891     }
00892 
00893     if (id->properties) {
00894         IDP_FreeProperty(id->properties);
00895         MEM_freeN(id->properties);
00896     }
00897 
00898     BLI_remlink(lb, id);
00899 
00900     /* this ID may be a driver target! */
00901     BKE_animdata_main_cb(G.main, animdata_dtar_clear_cb, (void *)id);
00902 
00903     MEM_freeN(id);
00904 }
00905 
00906 void free_libblock_us(ListBase *lb, void *idv)      /* test users */
00907 {
00908     ID *id= idv;
00909     
00910     id->us--;
00911 
00912     if (id->us<0) {
00913         if (id->lib) printf("ERROR block %s %s users %d\n", id->lib->name, id->name, id->us);
00914         else printf("ERROR block %s users %d\n", id->name, id->us);
00915     }
00916     if (id->us==0) {
00917         if ( GS(id->name)==ID_OB ) unlink_object((Object *)id);
00918         
00919         free_libblock(lb, id);
00920     }
00921 }
00922 
00923 
00924 void free_main(Main *mainvar)
00925 {
00926     /* also call when reading a file, erase all, etc */
00927     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY];
00928     int a;
00929 
00930     a= set_listbasepointers(mainvar, lbarray);
00931     while (a--) {
00932         ListBase *lb= lbarray[a];
00933         ID *id;
00934         
00935         while ( (id= lb->first) ) {
00936             free_libblock(lb, id);
00937         }
00938     }
00939 
00940     MEM_freeN(mainvar);
00941 }
00942 
00943 /* ***************** ID ************************ */
00944 
00945 
00946 ID *find_id(const char *type, const char *name)     /* type: "OB" or "MA" etc */
00947 {
00948     ListBase *lb= which_libbase(G.main, GS(type));
00949     return BLI_findstring(lb, name, offsetof(ID, name) + 2);
00950 }
00951 
00952 static void get_flags_for_id(ID *id, char *buf) 
00953 {
00954     int isfake= id->flag & LIB_FAKEUSER;
00955     int isnode=0;
00956         /* Writeout the flags for the entry, note there
00957          * is a small hack that writes 5 spaces instead
00958          * of 4 if no flags are displayed... this makes
00959          * things usually line up ok - better would be
00960          * to have that explicit, oh well - zr
00961          */
00962 
00963     if (GS(id->name)==ID_MA)
00964         isnode= ((Material *)id)->use_nodes;
00965     if (GS(id->name)==ID_TE)
00966         isnode= ((Tex *)id)->use_nodes;
00967     
00968     if (id->us<0)
00969         strcpy(buf, "-1W ");
00970     else if (!id->lib && !isfake && id->us && !isnode)
00971         strcpy(buf, "     ");
00972     else if (isnode)
00973         sprintf(buf, "%c%cN%c ", id->lib?'L':' ', isfake?'F':' ', (id->us==0)?'O':' ');
00974     else
00975         sprintf(buf, "%c%c%c ", id->lib?'L':' ', isfake?'F':' ', (id->us==0)?'O':' ');
00976 }
00977 
00978 #define IDPUP_NO_VIEWER 1
00979 
00980 static void IDnames_to_dyn_pupstring(DynStr *pupds, ListBase *lb, ID *link, short *nr, int hideflag)
00981 {
00982     int i, nids= BLI_countlist(lb);
00983         
00984     if (nr) *nr= -1;
00985     
00986     if (nr && nids>MAX_IDPUP) {
00987         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "DataBrowse %x-2");
00988         *nr= -2;
00989     }
00990     else {
00991         ID *id;
00992         
00993         for (i=0, id= lb->first; id; id= id->next, i++) {
00994             char numstr[32];
00995             
00996             if (nr && id==link) *nr= i+1;
00997 
00998             if (U.uiflag & USER_HIDE_DOT && id->name[2]=='.')
00999                 continue;
01000             if (hideflag & IDPUP_NO_VIEWER)
01001                 if (GS(id->name)==ID_IM)
01002                     if ( ((Image *)id)->source==IMA_SRC_VIEWER )
01003                         continue;
01004             
01005             get_flags_for_id(id, numstr);
01006                 
01007             BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, numstr);
01008             BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, id->name+2);
01009             BLI_snprintf(numstr, sizeof(numstr), "%%x%d", i+1);
01010             BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, numstr);
01011             
01012             /* icon */
01013             switch(GS(id->name))
01014             {
01015             case ID_MA: /* fall through */
01016             case ID_TE: /* fall through */
01017             case ID_IM: /* fall through */
01018             case ID_WO: /* fall through */
01019             case ID_LA: /* fall through */
01020                 BLI_snprintf(numstr, sizeof(numstr), "%%i%d", BKE_icon_getid(id) );
01021                 BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, numstr);
01022                 break;
01023             default:
01024                 break;
01025             }
01026             
01027             if (id->next)
01028                 BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "|");
01029         }
01030     }
01031 }
01032 
01033 
01034 /* used by headerbuttons.c buttons.c editobject.c editseq.c */
01035 /* if nr==NULL no MAX_IDPUP, this for non-header browsing */
01036 void IDnames_to_pupstring(const char **str, const char *title, const char *extraops, ListBase *lb, ID *link, short *nr)
01037 {
01038     DynStr *pupds= BLI_dynstr_new();
01039 
01040     if (title) {
01041         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, title);
01042         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "%t|");
01043     }
01044     
01045     if (extraops) {
01046         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, extraops);
01047         if (BLI_dynstr_get_len(pupds))
01048             BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "|");
01049     }
01050 
01051     IDnames_to_dyn_pupstring(pupds, lb, link, nr, 0);
01052     
01053     *str= BLI_dynstr_get_cstring(pupds);
01054     BLI_dynstr_free(pupds);
01055 }
01056 
01057 /* skips viewer images */
01058 #if 0 /* unused */
01059 void IMAnames_to_pupstring(const char **str, const char *title, const char *extraops, ListBase *lb, ID *link, short *nr)
01060 {
01061     DynStr *pupds= BLI_dynstr_new();
01062     
01063     if (title) {
01064         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, title);
01065         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "%t|");
01066     }
01067     
01068     if (extraops) {
01069         BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, extraops);
01070         if (BLI_dynstr_get_len(pupds))
01071             BLI_dynstr_append(pupds, "|");
01072     }
01073     
01074     IDnames_to_dyn_pupstring(pupds, lb, link, nr, IDPUP_NO_VIEWER);
01075     
01076     *str= BLI_dynstr_get_cstring(pupds);
01077     BLI_dynstr_free(pupds);
01078 }
01079 #endif
01080 
01081 void id_sort_by_name(ListBase *lb, ID *id)
01082 {
01083     ID *idtest;
01084     
01085     /* insert alphabetically */
01086     if (lb->first!=lb->last) {
01087         BLI_remlink(lb, id);
01088         
01089         idtest= lb->first;
01090         while (idtest) {
01091             if (BLI_strcasecmp(idtest->name, id->name)>0 || (idtest->lib && !id->lib)) {
01092                 BLI_insertlinkbefore(lb, idtest, id);
01093                 break;
01094             }
01095             idtest= idtest->next;
01096         }
01097         /* as last */
01098         if (idtest==NULL) {
01099             BLI_addtail(lb, id);
01100         }
01101     }
01102     
01103 }
01104 
01105 /*
01106  * Check to see if there is an ID with the same name as 'name'.
01107  * Returns the ID if so, if not, returns NULL
01108  */
01109 static ID *is_dupid(ListBase *lb, ID *id, const char *name)
01110 {
01111     ID *idtest=NULL;
01112     
01113     for ( idtest = lb->first; idtest; idtest = idtest->next ) {
01114         /* if idtest is not a lib */ 
01115         if ( id != idtest && idtest->lib == NULL ) {
01116             /* do not test alphabetic! */
01117             /* optimized */
01118             if ( idtest->name[2] == name[0] ) {
01119                 if (strcmp(name, idtest->name+2)==0) break;
01120             }
01121         }
01122     }
01123     
01124     return idtest;
01125 }
01126 
01127 /* 
01128  * Check to see if an ID name is already used, and find a new one if so.
01129  * Return 1 if created a new name (returned in name).
01130  *
01131  * Normally the ID that's being check is already in the ListBase, so ID *id
01132  * points at the new entry.  The Python Library module needs to know what
01133  * the name of a datablock will be before it is appended; in this case ID *id
01134  * id is NULL;
01135  */
01136 
01137 static int check_for_dupid(ListBase *lb, ID *id, char *name)
01138 {
01139     ID *idtest;
01140     int nr= 0, nrtest, a, left_len;
01141     char in_use[64]; /* use as a boolean array, unrelated to name length */
01142 
01143     char left[MAX_ID_NAME + 8], leftest[MAX_ID_NAME + 8];
01144 
01145     /* make sure input name is terminated properly */
01146     /* if ( strlen(name) > MAX_ID_NAME-3 ) name[MAX_ID_NAME-3]= 0; */
01147     /* removed since this is only ever called from one place - campbell */
01148 
01149     while (1) {
01150 
01151         /* phase 1: id already exists? */
01152         idtest = is_dupid(lb, id, name);
01153 
01154         /* if there is no double, done */
01155         if ( idtest == NULL ) return 0;
01156 
01157         /* we have a dup; need to make a new name */
01158         /* quick check so we can reuse one of first 64 ids if vacant */
01159         memset(in_use, 0, sizeof(in_use));
01160 
01161         /* get name portion, number portion ("name.number") */
01162         left_len= BLI_split_name_num(left, &nr, name, '.');
01163 
01164         /* if new name will be too long, truncate it */
01165         if (nr > 999 && left_len > (MAX_ID_NAME - 8)) {
01166             left[MAX_ID_NAME - 8]= 0;
01167             left_len= MAX_ID_NAME - 8;
01168         }
01169         else if (left_len > (MAX_ID_NAME - 7)) {
01170             left[MAX_ID_NAME - 7]= 0;
01171             left_len= MAX_ID_NAME - 7;
01172         }
01173 
01174         for (idtest= lb->first; idtest; idtest= idtest->next) {
01175             if (        (id != idtest) &&
01176                     (idtest->lib == NULL) &&
01177                     (*name == *(idtest->name+2)) &&
01178                     (strncmp(name, idtest->name+2, left_len)==0) &&
01179                     (BLI_split_name_num(leftest, &nrtest, idtest->name+2, '.') == left_len)
01180             ) {
01181                 if (nrtest < sizeof(in_use))
01182                     in_use[nrtest]= 1;  /* mark as used */
01183                 if (nr <= nrtest)
01184                     nr= nrtest+1;       /* track largest unused */
01185             }
01186         }
01187 
01188         /* decide which value of nr to use */
01189         for (a=0; a < sizeof(in_use); a++) {
01190             if (a>=nr) break;   /* stop when we've check up to biggest */
01191             if ( in_use[a]==0 ) { /* found an unused value */
01192                 nr = a;
01193                 break;
01194             }
01195         }
01196 
01197         /* If the original name has no numeric suffix, 
01198          * rather than just chopping and adding numbers, 
01199          * shave off the end chars until we have a unique name.
01200          * Check the null terminators match as well so we don't get Cube.000 -> Cube.00 */
01201         if (nr==0 && name[left_len]== '\0') {
01202             int len = left_len-1;
01203             idtest= is_dupid(lb, id, name);
01204             
01205             while (idtest && len> 1) {
01206                 name[len--] = '\0';
01207                 idtest= is_dupid(lb, id, name);
01208             }
01209             if (idtest == NULL) return 1;
01210             /* otherwise just continue and use a number suffix */
01211         }
01212         
01213         if (nr > 999 && left_len > (MAX_ID_NAME - 8)) {
01214             /* this would overflow name buffer */
01215             left[MAX_ID_NAME - 8] = 0;
01216             /* left_len = MAX_ID_NAME - 8; */ /* for now this isn't used again */
01217             memcpy(name, left, sizeof(char) * (MAX_ID_NAME - 7));
01218             continue;
01219         }
01220         /* this format specifier is from hell... */
01221         BLI_snprintf(name, sizeof(id->name) - 2,"%s.%.3d", left, nr);
01222 
01223         return 1;
01224     }
01225 }
01226 
01227 /*
01228  * Only for local blocks: external en indirect blocks already have a
01229  * unique ID.
01230  *
01231  * return 1: created a new name
01232  */
01233 
01234 int new_id(ListBase *lb, ID *id, const char *tname)
01235 {
01236     int result;
01237     char name[MAX_ID_NAME-2];
01238 
01239     /* if library, don't rename */
01240     if (id->lib) return 0;
01241 
01242     /* if no libdata given, look up based on ID */
01243     if (lb==NULL) lb= which_libbase(G.main, GS(id->name));
01244 
01245     /* if no name given, use name of current ID
01246      * else make a copy (tname args can be const) */
01247     if (tname==NULL)
01248         tname= id->name+2;
01249 
01250     strncpy(name, tname, sizeof(name)-1);
01251 
01252     /* if result > MAX_ID_NAME-3, strncpy don't put the final '\0' to name.
01253      * easier to assign each time then to check if its needed */
01254     name[sizeof(name)-1]= 0;
01255 
01256     if (name[0] == '\0') {
01257         /* disallow empty names */
01258         strcpy(name, ID_FALLBACK_NAME);
01259     }
01260     else {
01261         /* disallow non utf8 chars,
01262          * the interface checks for this but new ID's based on file names don't */
01263         BLI_utf8_invalid_strip(name, strlen(name));
01264     }
01265 
01266     result = check_for_dupid(lb, id, name);
01267     strcpy(id->name+2, name);
01268 
01269     /* This was in 2.43 and previous releases
01270      * however all data in blender should be sorted, not just duplicate names
01271      * sorting should not hurt, but noting just incause it alters the way other
01272      * functions work, so sort every time */
01273 #if 0
01274     if ( result )
01275         id_sort_by_name(lb, id);
01276 #endif
01277 
01278     id_sort_by_name(lb, id);
01279     
01280     return result;
01281 }
01282 
01283 /* Pull an ID out of a library (make it local). Only call this for IDs that
01284  * don't have other library users. */
01285 void id_clear_lib_data(Main *bmain, ID *id)
01286 {
01287     BKE_id_lib_local_paths(bmain, id->lib, id);
01288 
01289     id->lib= NULL;
01290     id->flag= LIB_LOCAL;
01291     new_id(which_libbase(bmain, GS(id->name)), id, NULL);
01292 }
01293 
01294 /* next to indirect usage in read/writefile also in editobject.c scene.c */
01295 void clear_id_newpoins(void)
01296 {
01297     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY];
01298     ID *id;
01299     int a;
01300 
01301     a= set_listbasepointers(G.main, lbarray);
01302     while (a--) {
01303         id= lbarray[a]->first;
01304         while (id) {
01305             id->newid= NULL;
01306             id->flag &= ~LIB_NEW;
01307             id= id->next;
01308         }
01309     }
01310 }
01311 
01312 #define LIBTAG(a)   if (a && a->id.lib) {a->id.flag &=~LIB_INDIRECT; a->id.flag |= LIB_EXTERN;}
01313 
01314 static void lib_indirect_test_id(ID *id, Library *lib)
01315 {
01316     
01317     if (id->lib) {
01318         /* datablocks that were indirectly related are now direct links
01319          * without this, appending data that has a link to other data will fail to write */
01320         if (lib && id->lib->parent == lib) {
01321             id_lib_extern(id);
01322         }
01323         return;
01324     }
01325     
01326     if (GS(id->name)==ID_OB) {      
01327         Object *ob= (Object *)id;
01328         Mesh *me;
01329 
01330         int a;
01331 
01332 #if 0   /* XXX OLD ANIMSYS, NLASTRIPS ARE NO LONGER USED */
01333         // XXX old animation system! --------------------------------------
01334         {
01335             bActionStrip *strip;
01336             for (strip=ob->nlastrips.first; strip; strip=strip->next) {
01337                 LIBTAG(strip->object);
01338                 LIBTAG(strip->act);
01339                 LIBTAG(strip->ipo);
01340             }
01341         }
01342         // XXX: new animation system needs something like this?
01343 #endif
01344 
01345         for (a=0; a<ob->totcol; a++) {
01346             LIBTAG(ob->mat[a]);
01347         }
01348     
01349         LIBTAG(ob->dup_group);
01350         LIBTAG(ob->proxy);
01351         
01352         me= ob->data;
01353         LIBTAG(me);
01354     }
01355 }
01356 
01357 void tag_main_lb(ListBase *lb, const short tag)
01358 {
01359     ID *id;
01360     if (tag) {
01361         for (id= lb->first; id; id= id->next) {
01362             id->flag |= LIB_DOIT;
01363         }
01364     }
01365     else {
01366         for (id= lb->first; id; id= id->next) {
01367             id->flag &= ~LIB_DOIT;
01368         }
01369     }
01370 }
01371 
01372 void tag_main_idcode(struct Main *mainvar, const short type, const short tag)
01373 {
01374     ListBase *lb= which_libbase(mainvar, type);
01375 
01376     tag_main_lb(lb, tag);
01377 }
01378 
01379 void tag_main(struct Main *mainvar, const short tag)
01380 {
01381     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY];
01382     int a;
01383 
01384     a= set_listbasepointers(mainvar, lbarray);
01385     while (a--) {
01386         tag_main_lb(lbarray[a], tag);
01387     }
01388 }
01389 
01390 /* if lib!=NULL, only all from lib local
01391  * bmain is almost certainly G.main */
01392 void BKE_library_make_local(Main *bmain, Library *lib, int untagged_only)
01393 {
01394     ListBase *lbarray[MAX_LIBARRAY], tempbase={NULL, NULL};
01395     ID *id, *idn;
01396     int a;
01397 
01398     a= set_listbasepointers(bmain, lbarray);
01399     while (a--) {
01400         id= lbarray[a]->first;
01401         
01402         while (id) {
01403             id->newid= NULL;
01404             idn= id->next;      /* id is possibly being inserted again */
01405             
01406             /* The check on the second line (LIB_PRE_EXISTING) is done so its
01407              * possible to tag data you don't want to be made local, used for
01408              * appending data, so any libdata already linked wont become local
01409              * (very nasty to discover all your links are lost after appending)  
01410              * */
01411             if (id->flag & (LIB_EXTERN|LIB_INDIRECT|LIB_NEW) &&
01412               (untagged_only==0 || !(id->flag & LIB_PRE_EXISTING)))
01413             {
01414                 if (lib==NULL || id->lib==lib) {
01415                     if (id->lib) {
01416                         id_clear_lib_data(bmain, id); /* sets 'id->flag' */
01417 
01418                         /* why sort alphabetically here but not in
01419                          * id_clear_lib_data() ? - campbell */
01420                         id_sort_by_name(lbarray[a], id);
01421                     }
01422                     else {
01423                         id->flag &= ~(LIB_EXTERN|LIB_INDIRECT|LIB_NEW);
01424                     }
01425                 }
01426             }
01427             id= idn;
01428         }
01429         
01430         /* patch2: make it aphabetically */
01431         while ( (id=tempbase.first) ) {
01432             BLI_remlink(&tempbase, id);
01433             BLI_addtail(lbarray[a], id);
01434             new_id(lbarray[a], id, NULL);
01435         }
01436     }
01437 
01438     /* patch 3: make sure library data isn't indirect falsely... */
01439     a= set_listbasepointers(bmain, lbarray);
01440     while (a--) {
01441         for (id= lbarray[a]->first; id; id=id->next)
01442             lib_indirect_test_id(id, lib);
01443     }
01444 }
01445 
01446 
01447 void test_idbutton(char *name)
01448 {
01449     /* called from buttons: when name already exists: call new_id */
01450     ListBase *lb;
01451     ID *idtest;
01452     
01453 
01454     lb= which_libbase(G.main, GS(name-2) );
01455     if (lb==NULL) return;
01456     
01457     /* search for id */
01458     idtest= BLI_findstring(lb, name, offsetof(ID, name) + 2);
01459 
01460     if (idtest) if ( new_id(lb, idtest, name)==0 ) id_sort_by_name(lb, idtest);
01461 }
01462 
01463 void text_idbutton(struct ID *id, char *text)
01464 {
01465     if (id) {
01466         if (GS(id->name)==ID_SCE)
01467             strcpy(text, "SCE: ");
01468         else if (GS(id->name)==ID_SCR)
01469             strcpy(text, "SCR: ");
01470         else if (GS(id->name)==ID_MA && ((Material*)id)->use_nodes)
01471             strcpy(text, "NT: ");
01472         else {
01473             text[0]= id->name[0];
01474             text[1]= id->name[1];
01475             text[2]= ':';
01476             text[3]= ' ';
01477             text[4]= 0;
01478         }
01479     }
01480     else {
01481         text[0]= '\0';
01482     }
01483 }
01484 
01485 void rename_id(ID *id, const char *name)
01486 {
01487     ListBase *lb;
01488 
01489     BLI_strncpy(id->name+2, name, sizeof(id->name)-2);
01490     lb= which_libbase(G.main, GS(id->name) );
01491     
01492     new_id(lb, id, name);               
01493 }
01494 
01495 void name_uiprefix_id(char *name, ID *id)
01496 {
01497     name[0] = id->lib ? 'L':' ';
01498     name[1] = id->flag & LIB_FAKEUSER ? 'F': (id->us==0)?'0':' ';
01499     name[2] = ' ';
01500 
01501     strcpy(name+3, id->name+2);
01502 }
01503 
01504 void BKE_library_filepath_set(Library *lib, const char *filepath)
01505 {
01506     /* in some cases this is used to update the absolute path from the
01507      * relative */
01508     if (lib->name != filepath) {
01509         BLI_strncpy(lib->name, filepath, sizeof(lib->name));
01510     }
01511 
01512     BLI_strncpy(lib->filepath, filepath, sizeof(lib->filepath));
01513 
01514     /* not essential but set filepath is an absolute copy of value which
01515      * is more useful if its kept in sync */
01516     if (strncmp(lib->filepath, "//", 2) == 0) {
01517         /* note that the file may be unsaved, in this case, setting the
01518          * filepath on an indirectly linked path is not allowed from the
01519          * outliner, and its not really supported but allow from here for now
01520          * since making local could cause this to be directly linked - campbell
01521          */
01522         const char *basepath= lib->parent ? lib->parent->filepath : G.main->name;
01523         BLI_path_abs(lib->filepath, basepath);
01524     }
01525 }
